title: Uber is Flooding my Mobile with SMS Daily  like a cron JOB
vulnerability_information:
The Issue is with the design of sending SMS by the uber referrals system, and every day it's flodding my phone number with driver invitaion message 

To reproduce this scenario i have  Fuzz the below request Through OWSAP Zap I fuzzed for 10,000 requests , keep the same Phone number (I have used my number), After 20 tries uber will send message the Limit is over ,  you will recieve 60 SMS since the meessage size is more it will come in three part , 

Now the real proble will start from next and consecutive days, Every day i'm recieving 60 SMS starting at 9:30 AM IST 
------------------------------

```
POST https://partners.uber.com/driver_invitations HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.11; rv:46.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/46.0
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: br
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Referer: https://partners.uber.com/referrals/
Content-Length: 137
Cookie: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
Connection: keep-alive
Host: partners.uber.com

{"_csrf_token":"1464319290-01-TE_leQUArIag4-5PKfW4wUkBccZdc_thW8kqNBmFFu4=","emails":[],"mobiles":["+████████"],"source":"dashboard"}
```

>>>>>>Attack Scenarion: A bad Victim can use this tool to irritate the other user (irrespective of their postion), by creating fake profiles and let's Uber take care of sending 60 SMS every day (NON STOP)  and finaly it will lead bad Impression on the UBER and
vulnerability_information_html:
The Issue is with the design of sending SMS by the uber referrals system, and every day it's flodding my phone number with driver invitaion message

To reproduce this scenario i have Fuzz the below request Through OWSAP Zap I fuzzed for 10,000 requests , keep the same Phone number (I have used my number), After 20 tries uber will send message the Limit is over , you will recieve 60 SMS since the meessage size is more it will come in three part ,

Now the real proble will start from next and consecutive days, Every day i'm recieving 60 SMS starting at 9:30 AM IST 

POST https://partners.uber.com/driver_invitations HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.11; rv:46.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/46.0

Attack Scenarion: A bad Victim can use this tool to irritate the other user (irrespective of their postion), by creating fake profiles and let's Uber take care of sending 60 SMS every day (NON STOP) and finaly it will lead bad Impression on the UBER and

activities.message:
Thanks for your report.

While we appreciate your efforts to help keep Uber secure, I'm afraid this doesn't qualify for this program; as there is rate limiting in place. While the threshold of the rate limits can be debated, we consider such recommendations to be best practices. As such, we'll be closing this report.

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for your report.

While we appreciate your efforts to help keep Uber secure, I'm afraid this doesn't qualify for this program; as there is rate limiting in place. While the threshold of the rate limits can be debated, we consider such recommendations to be best practices. As such, we'll be closing this report.

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hi Rob,
I appreciate company decision, tell me how can end user will  __unsubscribe from the getting 60 SMS Alerts every day__, this is a legal Issue as it's violating the user piracy policy of _DND (Do Not Disturb )_ , 

Why should a USER get  60 SMS every day from uber asking "I have invited by Uber to drive with Uber" and the End user don't know when this SMS will END 

Why it's become Legal, User's in INDIA is protected by India Penal Code, One of the ACT is DND (Do Not Disturb Policy) Which is applicable to Uber as it's Operation is in INDIA and it is set by TRAI (Telecom Regulatory Authority of INDIA)

Refer to ACT here
http://trai.gov.in/WriteReadData/userfiles/file/measuresto%20protectconsumerinterest/03.pdf

When a Driver Invite a friend he provide the phone number of his friend and Uber send SMS , the process should stop there , it's should not be recursive that every day Uber should send SMS to same Guy Again & Again 

Now End User has right to file a complaint if he has registered for DND Policy , Imagine you as a User getting 60 SMS every day 

I request to take this view point as a __Legal__ 

--
ANish

Now End User has right to file a complaint if he has registered for DND Policy , Imagine you as a User getting 60 SMS every day

I request to take this view point as a Legal

--
ANish

activities.message:
Hi Uber, 

I need to take Uber support to close my SMS  flood which is happening on my Mobile 


Thanks Uber, Usually SMS will triggered from 9:30 AM IST, since message content length is high it comes as three part, and Normal distribution is 20 message * 3 Part result in 60 SMS,  I Have raised this Issue with HackerOne Uber program, it got closed saying a design Issue but i got affected with the SMS flood every Day ,  This can be very dangerous when a mass population is affected , as people Mobile Number is in DND or roaming (Each SMS will charged), I request to re-open this Issue is HackeOne program also

activities.message: Hi Anish - so to be clear I understand the situation here: You used your own phone number to test something, queued up 10,000 sms messages to be sent to your own phone, accept we have rate limiting (but on the way out) and are now receiving 60 text messages a day and want it to stop?
activities.markdown_message: Hi Anish - so to be clear I understand the situation here: You used your own phone number to test something, queued up 10,000 sms messages to be sent to your own phone, accept we have rate limiting (but on the way out) and are now receiving 60 text messages a day and want it to stop?

activities.message:
I am not a lawyer but taking a quick read of the law you mentioned one of the first lines says

>The Authority has been receiving complaints from various quarters regarding telemarketing calls and unsolicited SMSs.

In this case these SMS messages are not unsolicited, you in fact requested them. Right?
activities.markdown_message:
I am not a lawyer but taking a quick read of the law you mentioned one of the first lines says

The Authority has been receiving complaints from various quarters regarding telemarketing calls and unsolicited SMSs.

In this case these SMS messages are not unsolicited, you in fact requested them. Right?

activities.message:
Hi Uber, 

Thanks for re-thinking the scenario, This Issue exisist with the design, where a Driver can invite another Driver through SMS

Attack Scenario:

Fake Driver (Attacker-Not Verfied) Invited another People (Might Be politician's, Business Man, or a DoNot Disturb Member, or the User is in Roaming where Each SMS will chanrged) has given the Mobile number to Uber to generate the Invite Message, The Attacker what extra did here he just queeed the SMS Message, and relaxed

No What Uber is doing Bad here is , it's sending Every Day 60 SMS Message to people and disturbing their privacy, People usually ignore 1 SMS message , but when you will recieve 60 SMS every day they will get frustrated too and can reach to TRAI or Provider to bring Law in place

I was a Vicitm of this flood, as I used my own number to re-produce this Scenrio, I need to then talked to the Uber Support to stopped the flood through twitter 

Usually SMS will triggered from 9:30 AM IST, since SMS content length is high it comes as three part, and Normal distribution is 20 message * 3 Part result in 60 SMS,    __This can be very dangerous when a mass population is affected , as people Mobile Number is in DND or roaming (Each SMS will charged), and can be booked Against DND Act__
 
I request to re-open this Issue, as a legal Issue to be addressed


__Mitigation__:
This feature should be given to Verfied Driver, as this reduce attack surface, and will be under Law, Uber can claim who generated the SMS Message
The Uber should verify whether the same number is Used or not
activities.markdown_message:
Hi Uber,

Thanks for re-thinking the scenario, This Issue exisist with the design, where a Driver can invite another Driver through SMS

Attack Scenario:

Fake Driver (Attacker-Not Verfied) Invited another People (Might Be politician's, Business Man, or a DoNot Disturb Member, or the User is in Roaming where Each SMS will chanrged) has given the Mobile number to Uber to generate the Invite Message, The Attacker what extra did here he just queeed the SMS Message, and relaxed

No What Uber is doing Bad here is , it's sending Every Day 60 SMS Message to people and disturbing their privacy, People usually ignore 1 SMS message , but when you will recieve 60 SMS every day they will get frustrated too and can reach to TRAI or Provider to bring Law in place

I was a Vicitm of this flood, as I used my own number to re-produce this Scenrio, I need to then talked to the Uber Support to stopped the flood through twitter

Usually SMS will triggered from 9:30 AM IST, since SMS content length is high it comes as three part, and Normal distribution is 20 message * 3 Part result in 60 SMS, This can be very dangerous when a mass population is affected , as people Mobile Number is in DND or roaming (Each SMS will charged), and can be booked Against DND Act

I request to re-open this Issue, as a legal Issue to be addressed

Mitigation:
This feature should be given to Verfied Driver, as this reduce attack surface, and will be under Law, Uber can claim who generated the SMS Message
The Uber should verify whether the same number is Used or not

activities.message:
@anish2good,

In the text messages you are receiving, it says "Reply STOP to stop receiving messages."

Did you respond "STOP"?

Thanks,
Rob
activities.markdown_message:
@anish2good,

In the text messages you are receiving, it says "Reply STOP to stop receiving messages."

Did you respond "STOP"?

Thanks,
Rob

activities.message:
Nope I didn't respond to STOP,  As the text message length is more than prescribed limit of SMS it come in three parts and it's appears as FLOOD (20*3=60 Message )so i not bother to read the Message , attached the screen-shot 

I tried the SAME use case with my roaming mobile number, where Incoming SMS got charged, with this feature, i have drained out mobile balance :)

activities.message:
@anish2good, ah ok, gotcha. Thanks for the details and we're continuing to look into this!

Please be patient with us through this process as we get everything sorted out.
activities.markdown_message:
@anish2good, ah ok, gotcha. Thanks for the details and we're continuing to look into this!

activities.message: @anish2good can you try responding "STOP" to one of the messages and see whether you receive any SMS's the following day?
activities.markdown_message: @anish2good can you try responding "STOP" to one of the messages and see whether you receive any SMS's the following day?

activities.message: Now I don't receive any messages, as i have contacted UBER Support to un-subscribe from all receiving messages, attached the Screen-SHOT
activities.markdown_message: Now I don't receive any messages, as i have contacted UBER Support to un-subscribe from all receiving messages, attached the Screen-SHOT

activities.message:
The mitigating factor in this vulnerability is the ability to reply STOP to these messages to stop receiving them - we have validated that responding STOP does in fact work as expected. Please feel free to provide any details refuting that claim.

As always, thanks for your participation in our bug bounty program and we encourage you to continue bug hunting in the future!
activities.markdown_message:
The mitigating factor in this vulnerability is the ability to reply STOP to these messages to stop receiving them - we have validated that responding STOP does in fact work as expected. Please feel free to provide any details refuting that claim.

As always, thanks for your participation in our bug bounty program and we encourage you to continue bug hunting in the future!
